radiographic_examinations.findings: The bases of the lungs are clear bilaterally. The liver appears homogeneous with no focal lesion. No intrahepatic biliary dilatation. The portal vein is patent. No radiopaque cholelithiasis. The pancreas and bilateral adrenal glands are unremarkable. Spleen is borderline in size measuring 13.8 cm. Kidneys present symmetric nephrograms. Cortical hypodensity within the lower pole of the right kidney is too small to characterize. No hydronephrosis or perinephric stranding. No bowel obstruction or bowel wall thickening. The appendix is visualized within the right lower quadrant, dilated to 9mm, fluid-filled, thickened wall, and with surrounding inflammatory changes consistent with acute appendicitis. No wall thickening of the cecum. No adjacent extraluminal foci of air or fluid collection. The colon is unremarkable. The aorta is normal in caliber without aneurysmal dilatation. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric adenopathy. The bladder is not well distended but grossly unremarkable. Distal opacified right ureter is without a filling defect. No pelvic free fluid. Prostate gland and seminal vesicles are within normal limits. No pathologically enlarged inguinal or pelvic sidewall adenopathy. No suspicious lytic or blastic lesions in osseous structures.
